title: Can you use an instrumental beat that a famous rapper used but without monitizing it? Do I have to use the same name of the song and rap about the title? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, you can. As long as you state it's for promotional use only. And no, you don't have to use the same concept as the original artist. In fact, many well known rappers record tracks over other artist’s beats and release them to dj’s as exclusive “freestyles”. As an unknown artist though, you may get flagged by youtube if you upload tracks using well known instrumentals. It's what happened to me. You can check out a couple of my tracks below where I did this. The first one is live, where I used the beat to “Point of No Return” by Immortal Technique. The second one is the one that kept getting flagged, I spit over “run this town” by Jay-Z. HallowJack - Stars n Stripes (Marine destroys Taliban and competition in Afghanistan HallowJack - Prowl This Town

Money is not the issue, but public performance of it is. As long as only you and your closest family hears it there’s no problem. If you for instance put it up on SoundCloud or YouTube you have made it available to the public and it makes you open to a copyright lawsuit. Using the same title can actually make it worse as then you also open yourself up for a lawsuit over trying to hitch a ride on someone else’s reputation.  Don’t be a copy. From a copyright standpoint you can’t base your work on someone else’s work without getting a permission (licence) to do so. You can find beats that are free to use at sites such as Looperman.

So in your room you recreate the instrumental of Spaceman da Destroya ‘s Bleed Like Me… a simple bass drum horn mix… and you freestyle in your room over the beat… no one knows and it’s all good. Now if you put it out there you have to give credit to the artist. You can make up whatever words you want just don’t try to pass it off as your beat. Stay up or Get Down, Spaceman da Destroya 8/14/2020 Escape from Earth
